drug.name: Samidorphan
drug.description: Samidorphan has been used in trials studying the treatment of Schizophrenia, Alcohol Dependence, and Binge Eating Disorder.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenanthrenes and derivatives. These are polycyclic compounds containing a phenanthrene moiety, which is a tricyclic aromatic compound with three non-linearly fused benzene.

drug-interaction.name: Methylnaltrexone
drug-interaction.description: Samidorphan may increase the opioid antagonism activities of Methylnaltrexone.

drug-interaction.name: Naloxegol
drug-interaction.description: Samidorphan may increase the opioid antagonism activities of Naloxegol.

drug-interaction.name: Tramadol
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Tramadol can be decreased when used in combination with Samidorphan.

drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Morphine can be decreased when used in combination with Samidorphan.
